nodes.bodyText: SonarCloud pushes to use boolean when possible to avoid issues with null objects

SonarCloud does not want a method to throw an exception if the body of code does not throw that exception. In our case we do this so that overriding methods can throw the exception. The Javadoc allows SonarCloud to ignore this.
What is the specific error SonarCloud is complaining about here? This may be a suggestion we want to ignore.

I undid this particular change, but the issue is SonarCloud wants you to either log and handle the exception OR re-throw the exception but it does not want you to do both. In this case we want to log the extra fields from the IntegrationRestException so we will ignore this smelly smell.
Is there a way we can keep the explicit declaration that this set is an ordered set (not necessarily sorted, but ordered)?
Where we create the Set we are creating a LinkedHashSet. SonarCloud reasonably points out that User's should not worry about the exact implementation of the Set so just return the generic Set type.

My worry is that it is imperative to the consumer of this object that order be maintained. If someone consumes this object by streaming over it and collecting to a generic set, then the order is lost. The API must somehow explicitly declare that this is ordered.
Alright, thats not a bad criticism, I can change this back and ignore the rule violation.
SonarCloud does not want a method to have unused parameters. In our case we do this so that overriding methods can use the parameter. The Javadoc allows SonarCloud to ignore this.
This gets logged later, we don't need to log this multiple times.
These errors get logged again later, the exception message is sufficient.
SonarCloud does not like an empty catch block unless there is a comment as to why
I think we as a team agreed to the convention of naming the exception ignored. We should remove this SonarCloud rule.

Is there a way for us to handle this type of Exception differently? It's all over the code base and almost always has the same content. Would handling these exceptions at the source be a better option?
SonarCloud does not like code in the switch cases, to make the cases easier to understand moved the code to a method
Would returning a boolean instead of a Boolean resolve this? I'd rather not use BooleanUtils everywhere.
Good catch
I think this is still wrong. Missing {} after "Error: "
Does this have to do with using Boolean rather than boolean? If so, we should fix that instead.

We would need to fix Response in integration-rest to resolve this. Which we should but until that gets fixed, this resolves any null issues that would come up. The current implementation of response.isStatusCodeError() does allow returning a null.
The reason this exists is to be overridable in different channel implementations. SonarCloud doesn't know that.
I think we may want to add this method back if we ever need to override it. Currently there is nowhere in Alert that overrides the method.
collect should be on its own line like map.
I think we could take this opportunity to use a bifunction here. The only difference is the Class calling of.
